question: What happened to the peasant's wheat-field every Saturday night?
answer1: trampled down

question: What did the peasant tell his sons to do?
answer1: spend a Saturday night in the field and to watch and see who trampled it down

question: Who was the make the first trial?
answer1: the oldest

question: Why was the young fellow unable to tell how the field was trampled down?
answer1: He fell asleep.

question: What happened when the second son lain a while?
answer1: He fell asleep.

question: Who was John by the Ashes?
answer1: The youngest son.

question: What did John by the Ashes do different from his brothers?
answer1: did not lie down by the upper ridge of the field but lower down and stayed awake

question: What did the three doves turn into?
answer1: the most beautiful maidens

question: What did the maidens do on the field?
answer1: danced with each other

question: What happened when the maidens wanted to put on their feathers again?
answer1: They could not find them anywhere.

question: Why could the maidens not find their feathers?
answer1: The young fellow gathered up all their feathers.

question: How did the maidens feel when they could not find their feathers?
answer1: frightened

question: Who guards the maidens?
answer1: three trolls

question: Why must the maidens trample the field?
answer1: A troll has enchanted them.

question: What will John by the Ashes try to do?
answer1: free the maidens

question: What did the middle maiden give John by the Ashes?
answer1: a ring

question: What did the maidens do after they put on their feathers?
answer1: flew back across forest and hill

question: Why did the brothers laugh at John by the Ashes?
answer1: They think he is not strong enough.
answer2: They do not think he is capable to fight the trolls.

question: Where did the young fellow set out to?
answer1: the place where the maidens lived

question: Where did the maidens live?
answer1: farther south than south and farther north than north in a great hill of gold

question: What were the two poor lads doing when John by the Ashes met them?
answer1: quarreling with each other about a pair of old shoes and a bamboo cane

question: What was special about the shoes and cane?
answer1: Whoever has the shoes on can cover a thousand miles in a single step and whatever is touched with this cane must die at once.

question: What happened when the young fellow put the boots on his feet?
answer1: He took a step and off he was, a thousand miles away.

question: What was special about the fiddle?
answer1: If someone is dead and you play this fiddle, he will come to life again.

question: How was the young fellow able to take the fiddle a thousand miles away?
answer1: His shoes.

question: Who did the young fellow meet a little later?
answer1: an old man

question: Why did the old man discourage the young fellow from going?
answer1: The troll who lived there killed every one.

question: What happened because the young fellow was so found of the middle maiden?
answer1: He must make the attempt whether it leads to life or death.

question: What did the young fellow have to do before he came into the hill to the maidens?
answer1: pass through three rooms

question: Why did the watchmen think that the young fellow would not get out again?
answer1: The troll would be back soon.
answer2: The troll would kill the young fellow.

question: What was the room with the maidens full of?
answer1: gold and silver

question: Why were the maidens frightened?
answer1: The troll would be along before long.

question: How did the young fellow defeat the trolls?
answer1: struck at the heads with his bamboo cane

question: How were the maidens brought back to life?
answer1: The young fellow took his fiddle and played.
